physdesc.label: Quantity
physdesc.extent: plus additions of 1.6 cubic ft. (3 boxes)

extref.corpname: University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee Libraries, Archives Department

did.abstract: This collection contains records from the Woman's Club of Wisconsin and the affiliated organizations of the Athenaeum Stock Company, the Guardian Realty Stock Company, the League of Patriotic Women, and the Woman's Club of Wisconsin Foundation, Inc. The records mainly consist of correspondence, meeting minutes, committee files, legal papers, architectural drawings, programs, newspaper clippings, newsletters, yearbooks, and photographs of the club and its members.

bioghist.p: The Woman's Club of Wisconsin was created in 1876 by a group of woman looking to enrich their lives with various social, intellectual, and philanthropic pursuits. They established the second club of its kind in the United States, the first being the Woman's Club of New England. In addition to this accomplishment, these founding women also created the very first all-women's stock company in the country. According to its mission statement, "The Woman's Club of Wisconsin is a private club providing its members with philanthropic, cultural, educational, and social activities. The club is dedicated to the support of, and involvement in, community service. The club is also committed to the preservation of its registered landmark building."

The collection includes many of the documents that went into celebration of the club's 125th anniversary in 2001, which led to the creation of the book, A Club of Their Own. This book chronicles the club's history and gave birth to the project undertaken by the history committee to gather and organize the club's records so that members of the club, as well as the community, can have access to the history of this pioneering organization. A Club of Their Own, is available in the Archives. Call number: (ARC) HQ1905.W6 T88x 2000.

scopecontent.p: Scope and content notes of each series are included in the contents list.

arrangement.p: This collection was received in, and is organized in, multiple parts. Additional materials have not been physically or intellectually arranged and interfiled, and researchers may need to consult more than one part of the collection to locate similar materials.
The collection is arranged into the following subgroups:

item.ref: Woman's Club of Wisconsin Foundation, Inc., 1961-2004

arrangement.p: The files are organized alphabetically by subject, then chronologically, within each group.
The collection contains two additional accessions.

otherfindaid.p: Finding aid for accession 2010-059 available in the Archives.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material in the UWM Libraries

separatedmaterial.head: Deaccession Information
separatedmaterial.p: Floral prints (removed from box 21) were returned to the Woman's Club of Wisconsin in October 2010.

accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on the materials, and the collection is open to all members of the public in accordance with state law.

userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of libel, privacy, and copyright which may be involved in the use of this collection (Wisconsin Statutes 19.21-19.39).

acqinfo.p: The Woman's Club of Wisconsin donated this collection to the Archives in December 2004 (accession 2004-040). The Club donated additional materials in April 2007 (accession 2006-055), June 2008 (accession 2007-067), and April 2010 (accession 2009-055). The Milwaukee County Historical Society donated Club materials, deaccessioned from its holdings, in February 2010 (accession 2009-045). The Club donated additional materials in June 2011 (accession 2010-059) and James Henderson donated additions in March 2013 (accession 2012-045). Valerie McDonald donated additions in April, 2014 (accession 2013-044).

processinfo.p: Ann Stachewicz processed the collection at the Woman's Club from June-August 2004 and at the Archives in January 2005. Christel Maass finished processing the collection in January and February 2005. Denise Gergetz (supervised by Christel Maass) processed accessions 2006-055 and 2007-067 in December 2009. Sarah Phillips (supervised by Christel Maass) processed accessions 2009-045 and 2009-055 in April 2010 (boxes 28-29).
In December 2011, Matt Eidem removed the safety film negatives from box 11, folder 6, and box 25, folder 35, and placed them in box 30.

Christel Maass updated the finding aid to include information about accessions 2010-059 and 2012-045 in August 2013. Hayley Jackson (supervised by Christel Maass) processed accessions 2013-044 and 2014-030 in May 2015 (boxes 31-32). Christel Maass added some publications from accession 2010-059 to the processed collection in June 2015.

scopecontent.p: The Athenaeum is the name of both the clubhouse building and the first stock company. Originally called the Pioneer Woman's Stock Company, it was later renamed the Athenaeum Company. This was the first all-woman's stock company in the United States, and was formed in 1886 to raise the funds needed to build the clubhouse. It was originally created as a separate entity from the Woman's Club of Wisconsin (WCW) with its own board of directors. All groups interested in using space within the building did so through the Athenaeum. In 1920 the Athenaeum formally merged with the WCW, but the name was still used for renting the building to outside clubs and parties. This subgroup includes photographs of the building and the first president, Martha Fitch.

did.unittitle: Deeds and Title to the Athenaeum, 1886
Legal Documents, Transfer of the Athenaeum to WCW, 1920-1921
Lists of Receptions, Parties, and Cotillions, 1888-1893
Speeches Given to Board of Directors, 1886-1890
Newspaper Clippings, Formation of the Athenaeum Company, 1923, 1964

physdesc.extent: Bound volume of exterior views of the building and interior views of rooms and furnishings.

scopecontent.p: The Guardian Realty Company was the second stock company formed by the club. Created in 1924, its purpose was to raise money needed to purchase several properties surrounding the club in preparation for future expansion. The clubhouse addition was completed in 1936, and in February of that year Guardian Realty was dissolved. This subgroup mainly consists of financial and legal materials.

This league formed in 1917 in response to the United States' entrance into World War I. The Woman's Club of Wisconsin invited all the women from various clubs in Milwaukee to join them in March of 1917 to form the league. Soon after the league merged with the National League for Women's Service, which was based in New York City. Records include information on the first meeting and the formation of the league.

did.unittitle: First Meeting Invitation and Notes, March 7, 1917
List of Participating Organizations and Copy of Telegram Sent to President Woodrow Wilson, undated
Newspaper Clippings, Formation of the League, 1917

scopecontent.p: The Woman's Club of Wisconsin has a board of directors consisting of a president, several vice presidents, corresponding secretary, recording secretary, treasurer, and members-at-large. In addition to the records of the board of directors and many committees and sub-committees, this subgroup, which makes up the bulk of this collection, contains materials documenting the club's history, activities, and programs; finances; building, including architectural drawings; and membership. Also included are newsletters, yearbooks, and photographs.

5. Woman's Club of Wisconsin Foundation, Inc., 1961-2004

scopecontent.p: The Woman's Club of Wisconsin Foundation, Inc. was founded to assume many of the duties previously handled by the welfare committee. The foundation is solely a philanthropic organization, in charge of reviewing and awarding grant money to various community organizations in need of assistance. Although legally a separate entity, the foundation works closely with the Woman's Club and shares many club projects. Records include board of directors and committee minutes, financial reports, and publicity materials.

did.unittitle: Community Outreach and Foundation Development Committees, 1988-1994

did.abstract: Additions of records from 1999 to 2001, as well as miscellaneous records from earlier years (1980-2000).
Additions of 3 volumes of Athenaeum board meeting minutes, dating from 1893 to 1907 and 1913 to 1919.
